  3. Tolmount

Tolmount

Hear pronunciation Press to hear pronunciation

Tolmount looks a fine cone-like peak when seen from Loch Callater; otherwise it is a twin to its close neighbour Tom Buidhe - a simple rounded dome-like upthrust on the wide Mounth plateau.

 You have not climbed Tolmount.

Region: Cairngorms

Altitude: 958 metres

Users' Rating:
  • Currently 2.53/5
Rating: 2.5/5 (88 votes cast)

You must be registered and signed-in to vote

Detailed route description and map

Tolmount and Tom Buidhe via Loch Callater

Other routes and challenges

There are several alternative options for climbing Tolmount and its neighbour. One is to start from Glen Doll at the head of Glen Clova, approaching via Jock's Road over Crow Craigies.

Another longer option is to include this pair of Munros with the Glas Maol group of 4, making a total of 6 Munros on an outing from the top of the Cairnwell Pass.

Walker-friendly accommodation in the area

Braemar Hotels

Braemar B&B

Cairngorms hostels
